p: The fresh aerial parts (250 g) of T. serrulatus were cut into small pieces and distilled (hydro-distillation) for 3 h in Clevenger-type apparatus. The process was repeated 11 times to get enough oil. The essential oil obtained was dried with anhydrous sodium sulfate and kept in closed vials at 4°C in a refrigerator ( Asfaw et al., 2000). The percent yield of the obtained essential oil was calculated based on the weight of the fresh plant material ( v/w).
